studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: Oral bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate administered once daily at 15 mg and 30 mg doses to participants with Wilson disease

studyInterventions.name: Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet
studyInterventions.description: Standardized copper- and molybdenum-controlled meals provided during inpatient periods to control dietary copper and molybdenum intake

administrableProducts.name: ALXN1840 tablets
administrableProducts.strength: 15 mg ALXN1840 containing 7.8 mg tetrathiomolybdic acid

administrations.name: ALXN1840 15 mg once daily maintained beyond 4 weeks
administrations.duration: Up to Day 39 if escalation to 30 mg is not performed for safety reasons

administrations.name: ALXN1840 reduced dosing to 15 mg every other day (dose modification)
administrations.duration: As needed per dose modification criteria

administrations.name: ALXN1840 temporary interruption
administrations.duration: Until laboratory/safety parameters improve per protocol criteria

administrations.name: ALXN1840 outpatient dosing
administrations.dose: 15 mg or 30 mg according to assigned dose
administrations.duration: Outpatient Period between Day 9 and Day 23 (may be extended up to an additional 14 days)

substances.name: bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active pharmaceutical ingredient in ALXN1840; a copper-binding agent also referred to as tetrathiomolybdate

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdic acid
substances.description: Acid form providing the active anion tetrathiomolybdate in ALXN1840 tablets

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active anion of ALXN1840 responsible for copper binding and decoppering effects

interventions.name: ALXN1840
interventions.description: Oral bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate administered once daily at 15 mg and 30 mg doses to participants with Wilson disease

interventions.name: Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet
interventions.description: Standardized copper- and molybdenum-controlled meals provided during inpatient periods to control dietary copper and molybdenum intake

products.name: ALXN1840 tablets
products.strength: 15 mg ALXN1840 containing 7.8 mg tetrathiomolybdic acid

substances.name: bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active pharmaceutical ingredient in ALXN1840; a copper-binding agent also referred to as tetrathiomolybdate

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdic acid
substances.description: Acid form providing the active anion tetrathiomolybdate in ALXN1840 tablets

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active anion of ALXN1840 responsible for copper binding and decoppering effects

administrations.name: ALXN1840 15 mg once daily, Days 1–28
administrations.instructions: Administered as one 15 mg tablet after an overnight fast (at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning with 240 mL of water; meals delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing

administrations.name: ALXN1840 30 mg once daily, Days 29–39
administrations.instructions: Administered as two 15 mg tablets (total 30 mg) after an overnight fast at the same time every morning with 240 mL of water; meals delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. Escalation contingent on Safety Review Committee review of safety data through Day 23

administrations.name: ALXN1840 15 mg once daily maintained beyond 4 weeks
administrations.duration: Up to Day 39 if escalation to 30 mg is not performed for safety reasons
administrations.instructions: Participants may remain on 15 mg/day for the duration of the study if, in the opinion of the Investigator and/or Alexion, escalation to 30 mg/day would place participants at undue risk

administrations.name: ALXN1840 reduced dosing to 15 mg every other day (dose modification)
administrations.duration: As needed per dose modification criteria
administrations.instructions: Dose range allowed by protocol for toxicity management is 15 mg every other day up to 30 mg/day. Used when criteria such as elevated ALT, anemia, thrombocytopenia, or neutropenia are met

administrations.name: ALXN1840 temporary interruption
administrations.duration: Until laboratory/safety parameters improve per protocol criteria
administrations.instructions: Temporarily interrupt dosing when specified safety thresholds are reached (e.g., ALT >5× ULN or >5× increase from baseline, hemoglobin <8 g/dL, platelets <30,000/µL, neutrophils <1.0×10^3/µL), with weekly repeat testing and possible rechallenge at 15 mg every other day once parameters normalize

administrations.name: ALXN1840 outpatient dosing
administrations.dose: 15 mg or 30 mg according to assigned dose
administrations.duration: Outpatient Period between Day 9 and Day 23 (may be extended up to an additional 14 days)
administrations.instructions: Participants self-administer ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (±1 hour) on an empty stomach with a glass of water; meals delayed at least 2 hours after dosing; SMS text messaging used to confirm administration
